rComments: Having taken both ECON 102 and 103 from him, I have one advice: aviod hime like a plague. His teaching is terrible- basically he just rumbles on and on. He is aloof and unhelpful and makes little sense. You will need to memorize the whole book and willl still be lucky if you get more than a B. Good luck with him!

idk y he gets such a bad rep. hes a good teacher, and the class is not very difficult if you actually go and take good notes. tests are pretty hard, they make you apply what you've learned to real world problems, which can be difficult. if you want to actually learn economics, take gottheil.

Lectures are not bad if you attend them, only thing is that his classes are too early in the morning. Also, if you read the text its more than enough. Pop quizes in lectures make it compulsory to attend. Exams are a little difficult.
Very respectable economist, terrible teacher. I know this man is probably very intelligent, but avoid his teaching at all costs
the WORST.

People who have recently taken this class and bashed those of us who had him last year and before need to realize that he changed the format of his tests.  They are much easier now and don't involve 11 page-long essays.  This just in: Essays are harder and able to be critiqued more than short answers.  Still, just read the book and get an A or B.

Im kinda sick of people giving  Gotheil bad ratings, its not his fault you did not do his work. I have never attended lecture even though we had pop quizes they are only worth 5% of your grade. I still ended up with an A just read the book and the tests will be really easy remember the main concepts and the vocab words this class is a joke.

While a lot of people mention that Professor Gottheil is difficult, it is just that his lectures were sometimes pointless. Case in point: he spent about 20 minutes last semester talking about chicken slaughter one lecture. The other 20 minutes were actually useful, contrary to popular opinion. GO TO TA SESSIONS AND READ and you will be OK.

Professor Gottheil is probably the worst professor on campus. He grades really hard. He deviates from the subject matter quite a bit during lectures and clicks his tongue a lot. All of his midterms are in essay format. He likes failing people. Currently, he is on probation. A very bad professor.

I should have listened to ppl on here for the midterm... MEMORIZE THE BOOK!!!!! I seriously memorized his book word for word for the final and the final was EASY after doing so. I ended up with an A somehow. Lectures are pointless but yout have to go for the stupid pop quizzes.

I felt that he was absolutely brilliant, not too difficult to score also, all exams were short answers ad easy. It does get a little boring in lectures sometimes, but he takes a real interest in teaching, you feel sleepy cause of the early morning or else i feel lecture is good. The TAs are pretty okay, but Prof. GOTTHEIL is reallly really good.

Terrible teacher!!  All he does is ramble about fish markets and how much better Canada is than everywhere else.  MEMORIZE THE BOOK.  His tests are based off of exactly what is in the book including graphs and definitions.  Somehow got a B after I failed the mid term.  Grades very strictly on tests.  My TA's English was terrible! Terrible Class

Don't take this class if you just need it for a gen ed, because it is definitely not a blow off class. This prof rambles about his family and makes annoying clicking noises with his mouth all the time. I wouldn't have gone to lectures if I didn't need to, but he gives random pop quizzes. To get an A, you seriously have to memorize the book.

Three words: READ THE BOOK. His tests are all based off his book, so memorize it! You basically have to teach yourself the material. Lectures are boring and his TA's don't speak any English. And the only reason I went to class was to do the pop quizzes. 8am is too early get the 9am!

Somehow, I managed to get a B in this class, which is remarkable considering I failed the midterm. He only gives 2 tests, which constitute 72% of the grade. His lectures are pointless, and after awhile, I stopped paying attention. I only went for the possible attendance quizzes. He rambles about nonsense and his TAs are all foreign.

He is a good professor despite the demon-like stereotype that surrounds him. If paid attention to, his stories clarify the material and deepen understanding. I enjoyed going to class everyday. The tests are not any more impossible than any other class. Study and go to class and you'll do fine.

The tests are hard and cover every detail of the book, while the lectures only regurgitate just a little from the book, so you are better off just reading the book and not going to lecture unless you want to hear his infamous clicking and Canadian accent. The Ta's aren't helpful either. The course has interesting info, but bad structure.

The class was pretty difficult... a lot of material I stopped going to lectures cause i got sick of hearing about his brother's hat factory, fish and his clicking noises.  Just read the book and u will be fine.

He was kinda mean to a kid during a Q & A session for a midterm we just took. The student got a question wrong and he took about 7 minutes just talking about the person getting it wrong and then finally kinda-halfway gave us the right answer. I felt really bad for the person who asked the question.
He is a really nice guy, he just has no idea how to teach.  He jumps around on topics and really can't make anyone understand anything.  Only take his class if you have no way around it.
